# Decimal Numbers Test

This document tests handling of decimal/float numbers in citations.

## Decimal Citations

Regular citations: [1], [2], [3]
Decimal citations: [1.5], [2.3], [3.14159]

## Decimal Ranges

Normal range: [1-3]
Decimal range: [1.1-3.9]
Mixed: [1-2.5] or [1.5-3]

## Scientific Notation

Exponential: [1e5], [2.5e-3], [3.14e+2]

## Measurement Context

The value is 1.5 meters [1].
Temperature rose by 2.3 degrees [2].
Pi is approximately 3.14159 [3].

## Multiple Decimals

Citation with dots: [1.2.3]
Version-like: [2.0.1]

## Valid Citations

Only integers should work:
- First citation [1]
- Second citation [2]
- Third citation [3]

[1]: https://example.com/first
[2]: https://example.com/second
[3]: https://example.com/third
